newsitem.title: USA: Commerce to begin mining in El Salvador.
newsitem.headline: Commerce to begin mining in El Salvador.

text.p: Commerce Group Corp said Thursday it expects drilling could begin as early as next week at its 52 percent-owned San Sebastian gold mine in El Salvador.
Commerce Group said it had completed funding for the first stage of its development of a high volume open-pit heap-leach operation at its San Sebastian gold mine.
Development of the mine will allow the company to expand its gold ore reserves, which stood at about 1.7 million ounces at December 31, 1996, the company said.
Commerce Group also said it would buy equipment needed to increase gold production at its existing processing operation at its San Cristobal mill and plant near El Divisadero, El Salvador.
Funds for the equipment and mining were generated by a $2.5 million placement of securities completed on January 31, 1997, Commerce Group said.
Shares of Commerce Group were trading off 3/8 at 3-1/8.
